es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions module

Author: Franklyn Dunbar Date: 2024-03-07 Email: franklyn.dunbar@earthscope.org

class es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.PingData(*, PingTime: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=0), Le(le=86400)] = None, TriggerTime: Annotated[datetime, Ge(ge=datetime.datetime(1980, 1, 6, 0, 0, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc))] = None, PingOffset: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=-60), Le(le=60)] = None, ADJ_LEAP: float = 1.0)

Bases: BaseModel

Represents Ping Data with timestamps and related attributes.

TriggerTime

Time when the ping was triggered (modified Julian day) [float].

Type:

datetime

PingTime

Time when the ping was received [float].

Type:

float

PingOffset

Offset time between trigger and ping [s].

Type:

float

ADJ_LEAP

Adjustment for leap time.

Type:

float

TRIGGER_DELAY

Trigger delay time.

Type:

float

ADJ_LEAP: float
PingOffset: float
PingTime: float
TriggerTime: datetime
classmethod from_line(line) → PingData

Create a PingData instance from a line of text.

Parameters:

  • line (str) – A line of text containing comma-separated values.

  • mode (WaveGlider, optional) – The mode of the WaveGlider. Defaults to WaveGlider.SV2.

Returns:

An instance of PingData created from the provided line.

Return type:

PingData

Example

>>> line = "2003,327374,1527706574,2018/05/30 18:56:14.697 PING - Offset = 0.000"
>>> PingData.from_line(line)
PingData(PingTime=58268.539063657634, TriggerTime=datetime.datetime(2018, 5, 30, 12, 56, 14), PingOffset=0.0, ADJ_LEAP=1.0, TRIGGER_DELAY=0.1)

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'ADJ_LEAP': FieldInfo(annotation=float, required=False, default=1.0), 'PingOffset': FieldInfo(annotation=float, required=False, default=None, metadata=[Ge(ge=-60), Le(le=60)]), 'PingTime': FieldInfo(annotation=float, required=False, default=None, metadata=[Ge(ge=0), Le(le=86400)]), 'TriggerTime': FieldInfo(annotation=datetime, required=False, default=None, metadata=[Ge(ge=datetime.datetime(1980, 1, 6, 0, 0, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc))])}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

class es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.TransponderData(*, TransponderID: str, tt: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=0.0), Le(le=600)], ReturnTime: Annotated[float, Ge(ge=0), Le(le=86400)], dbv: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=-100), Le(le=100)], CorrelationScore: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0), Le(le=100)], SignalToNoise: Annotated[float | None, Ge(ge=0), Le(le=100)] = 0, TurnAroundTime: Annotated[float | None, Ge(ge=0), Le(le=100)] = 0)

Bases: BaseModel

Data class representing acoustic data measurements between a transducer and an indivudual transponder.

TransponderID

The unique identifier for the transponder.

Type:

str

tt

The two-way travel time in seconds [s].

Type:

float, optional

ReturnTime

The return time julian day [days]

Type:

float, optional

dbv

Signal relative to full scale voltage in dB.

Type:

int

CorrelationScore

Correlation score.

Type:

int

CorrelationScore: int
dbv: int
ReturnTime: float
SignalToNoise: float | None
TransponderID: str
TurnAroundTime: float | None
tt: float
correct_travel_time(offset: float)

Corrects the travel time by applying the given offset.

Parameters:

offset (float) – The offset value in milliseconds.

Returns:

None

es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.dfpo00_to_acousticdf(source: DFPO00RawFile) → DataFrame[AcousticDataFrame]
es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.from_simultaneous_interrogation(si_set: List[SimultaneousInterrogation]) → DataFrame | None

Generate a validated AcousticDataFrame from a list of SimultaneousInterrogation instances.

es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.get_transponder_offsets(line: str) → Dict[str, float]

Extract the transponder offsets from a line of text. offsets are in milliseconds.

Parameters:

line (str) – A line of text containing transponder offsets.

Returns:

A dictionary

Return type:

Dict[str,float]

Example

>>> line = "2003,327353,1527706553,2018/05/30 18:55:53.519 >CS:2010,TAT200,..."
>>> AcousticDataFrame.get_transponder_offsets(line)
{"2010":200}
es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.qcpin_to_acousticdf(source: QCPinFile) → None | DataFrame[AcousticDataFrame]
es_sfgtools.processing.functions.acoustic_functions.sonardyne_to_acousticdf(source: SonardyneFile) → DataFrame[AcousticDataFrame]

Read data from a file and return a validated dataframe.

Parameters:

  • file (str) – Path to the file containing the acoustic data.

  • mode (WaveGlider, optional) – The mode of the WaveGlider. Defaults to WaveGlider.SV2.

  • source (str, optional) – The source of the data. Defaults to None.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the file specified by file does not exist.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the acoustic data if successfully validated, otherwise returns SchemaErrors.

Return type:

Union[pd.DataFrame, pa.errors.SchemaErrors]

Example

>>> file = "tests/resources/test_sonardyne_raw.txt"
>>> df = AcousticDataFrame.from_file(file)
INFO:root:Processed 4.0 shots from "tests/resources/test_sonardyne_raw.txt"
>>> print(df.head())
                                     PingTime      ReturnTime       tt  dbv  CorrelationScore
TriggerTime          TransponderID
2018-05-30 12:55:59  5209           58268.538890  58268.538942          4.447123             -21                85
                     5210           58268.538890  58268.538928          3.291827               0                85
                     5211           58268.538890  58268.538953          5.446601             -24                75
2018-05-30 12:56:14  5209           58268.539064  58268.539115          4.452981             -18                75
                     5210           58268.539064  58268.539102          3.289823               0                90
                     5211           58268.539064  58268.539127          5.442233             -24                65
2018-05-30 12:56:29  5209           58268.539237  58268.539289          4.458378             -15                65
                     5210           58268.539237  58268.539275          3.286848               0                85
                     5211           58268.539237  58268.539300          5.437492             -24                70
